documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently does not support indefinite carry-over of unused air ticket balances. Users cannot automatically transfer unused ticket allowances between policy years, which limits flexibility in time-off management.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Admins configuring air ticket policies must manually calculate total requests across multi-year cycles (e.g., 5 requests/year × 5 years = 25 total requests). No automatic carry-over of unused balances between years.
documentation_candidates.workaround: For multi-year policies requiring X requests per year over Y years, set total number of requests to X × Y. Example: 5 requests/year for 5-year cycle = set total to 25 requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Policy Configuration — Multi-Year Cycles and Request Allocation

documentation_candidates.summary: Air tickets - Booked tickets notification (tagging LM when not in approval flow OR workflow on ticket requests)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently cannot notify or tag line managers about ticket processing when they are outside the standard approval flow. There is no automated notification system for proxy requesters or managers raising requests for employees.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Line managers who submit air ticket requests on behalf of blue collar employees cannot receive notifications or track completion status unless they are part of the formal approval workflow. Creates visibility gap for proxy requesters.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Include line managers in the air ticket approval workflow to enable notifications, or use email/manual communication as interim tracking method.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Request Notifications — Tracking Status for Proxy Requesters

documentation_candidates.summary: As an employee I want to manage my air ticket requests from my air tickets
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The platform currently lacks a unified interface for employees to manage air ticket requests under various policy conditions. There are specific scenarios where employees cannot fully interact with or understand their air ticket encashment status.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employees cannot manage air ticket requests when: auto-encashment policy is inactive, hire date/probation end date is missing, employee is not yet eligible for encashment, or awaiting next encashment cycle. Limited visibility into encashment status.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Contact HR/Admin to verify policy activation, complete employee record data (hire date, probation end date), and confirm eligibility status before attempting to manage air ticket requests.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Air Ticket Auto-Encashment — Policy Eligibility and Status Visibility

documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Expense Manager role lacks granular permission controls to limit data visibility. The platform does not provide configurable options to restrict cross-module access or segment viewable financial information by category.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Users with Expense Manager role can view all employee loans and air tickets, not just work expenses. No granular controls to restrict visibility to specific financial data categories.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Implement additional role restrictions at the organizational level or use separate user accounts with different permission sets for different financial data categories.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Role-Based Access Control — Expense Manager Visibility Scope

documentation_candidates.summary: Letter requests - upload the document after stamping
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The current Bayzat platform does not support a flexible document approval workflow that allows post-approval modifications, attachment uploads, or status reversions for letter requests.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Users cannot download letter requests, stamp them externally, and re-upload signed documents. System requires approval before download (to remove draft watermark), but approved requests cannot be modified or have attachments added. Cannot return approved requests to pending status.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Use email-based document sharing for external stamping/attestation workflow, or request super admin to manually manage document attachments outside the system.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Letter Request Workflow — External Stamping and Document Re-Upload Limitations

documentation_candidates.summary: Limited access for employees to view other users
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks comprehensive employee visibility controls across HR modules. While some modules like Payroll and Work Expenses have partial employee grouping capabilities, the HR employee directory lacks granular access restriction functionality.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Non-manager employees can view all company employee profiles and contact information via 'Find a Colleague' feature. Employee grouping/structures are available on-demand for Payroll, Work Expenses, Loans, and Air Tickets modules, but not yet for HR modules including employee directory.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Employee grouping and structures feature is available on-demand for finance/payroll/expense modules. For HR module visibility control, contact Bayzat support to discuss custom development options or timeline for HR module support.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Visibility and Access Control — Using Employee Groups and Structures

documentation_candidates.summary: Restricted People manager role - can still see other employees (out of assigned group)
documentation_candidates.limitation_statement: The Bayzat platform currently lacks full role-based group restrictions, with grouping functionality limited to finance and payroll modules. People Manager and Adjustment Manager roles can view and edit employees outside their assigned groups across HR and document modules.
documentation_candidates.user_impact: Employee grouping restrictions only apply to finance and payroll modules. People Manager role grouping only restricts Air Tickets module visibility. Documents, Departments, and employee work tabs remain visible across all groups. Adjustment Manager role also shows all adjustments despite group restrictions.
documentation_candidates.workaround: Use employee grouping for finance/payroll/expense modules only. For HR module access control, implement organizational policies or request custom role configuration from Bayzat support.
documentation_candidates.guide_section: Employee Groups and Role Restrictions — Module-Specific Limitations

excluded.summary: Need to delete the test air tickets processed
excluded.reason: While this reveals a feature gap (no deletion of processed air tickets), it is not testable via Playwright because there is no UI mechanism to test - the feature simply does not exist. The limitation is already documented in the system behavior. No test can validate a missing feature.
